title: Ben Stokes, Jos Buttler sign England contract extension, five players secure first-time deals
description: The ECB announced its list of men's centrally contracted players for the 2024/25 season on Thursday, which included extensions for international skippers Ben Stokes and Jos Buttler.
author: Rahul Iyer
excerpt: The ECB announced its list of men's centrally contracted players for the 2024/25 season on Thursday, which included extensions for international skippers Ben Stokes and Jos Buttler.
text: Oct 31, 2024 2 minute read News The ECB announced its list of men's centrally contracted players for the 2024/25 season on Thursday, which included extensions for international skippers Ben Stokes and Jos Buttler. The ECB introduced multi-year central contracts from the start of the 2023/24 season, and a total of 18 players signed deals running for two or three years last October One of the most notable players to earn only a one-year contract last year was Test captain Ben Stokes, who turned down the ECB's offer of a three-year deal. It had been confirmed earlier this month, though, that Stokes had signed a new two-year deal, which is reflected in the current contract list. Read more: WTC points table: Updated World Test Championship standings after South Africa whitewash Bangladesh White-ball skipper Jos Buttler signed a two-year contract last year, and has secured another one starting from this season. He will now be contracted until 2026. Buttler has not played any competitive cricket since the 2024 T20 World Cup in June, having suffered a calf injury which ruled him out of The Hundred entirely, before he missed the white-ball series against Australia in September. Buttler's rehabilitation from the injury suffered a "setback" last week, and he will miss the ODI series against West Indies in the Caribbean. However, he is still expected to play the five-match T20I series. Five other players have secured central contracts for the first time – Jamie Smith (2 years), Shoaib Bashir (1 year), Will Jacks (1 year), Phil Salt (1 year) and Olly Stone (1 year). Jacob Bethell and Josh Hull have signed development contracts, as has John Turner who did so last year as well. Full list of England's centrally contracted players for the 2024/25 season Name County Contract Length Gus Atkinson Surrey 2 years Harry Brook Yorkshire 2 years Jos Buttler Lancashire 2 years Joe Root Yorkshire 2 years Jamie Smith Surrey 2 years Ben Stokes Durham 2 years Mark Wood Durham 2 years Rehan Ahmed Leicestershire 1 year Jofra Archer Sussex 1 year Jonny Bairstow Yorkshire 1 year Shoaib Bashir Somerset 1 year Brydon Carse Durham 1 year Zak Crawley Kent 1 year Sam Curran Surrey 1 year Ben Duckett Nottinghamshire 1 year Will Jacks Surrey 1 year Jack Leach Somerset 1 year Liam Livingstone Lancashire 1 year Ollie Pope Surrey 1 year Matthew Potts Durham 1 year Adil Rashid Yorkshire 1 year Phil Salt Lancashire 1 year Olly Stone Nottinghamshire 1 year Josh Tongue Nottinghamshire 1 year Reece Topley Surrey 1 year Chris Woakes Warwickshire 1 year Jacob Bethell Warwickshire Development contract Josh Hull Leicestershire Development contract John Turner Hampshire Development contract Follow Wisden for all cricket updates, including live scores, match stats, quizzes and more. html:
Oct 31, 2024 2 minute read News

The ECB announced its list of men's centrally contracted players for the 2024/25 season on Thursday, which included extensions for international skippers Ben Stokes and Jos Buttler.

The ECB introduced multi-year central contracts from the start of the 2023/24 season, and a total of 18 players signed deals running for two or three years last October

One of the most notable players to earn only a one-year contract last year was Test captain Ben Stokes, who turned down the ECB's offer of a three-year deal. It had been confirmed earlier this month, though, that Stokes had signed a new two-year deal, which is reflected in the current contract list.

Read more: WTC points table: Updated World Test Championship standings after South Africa whitewash Bangladesh

White-ball skipper Jos Buttler signed a two-year contract last year, and has secured another one starting from this season. He will now be contracted until 2026.

Buttler has not played any competitive cricket since the 2024 T20 World Cup in June, having suffered a calf injury which ruled him out of The Hundred entirely, before he missed the white-ball series against Australia in September.

Buttler's rehabilitation from the injury suffered a "setback" last week, and he will miss the ODI series against West Indies in the Caribbean. However, he is still expected to play the five-match T20I series.

Five other players have secured central contracts for the first time – Jamie Smith (2 years), Shoaib Bashir (1 year), Will Jacks (1 year), Phil Salt (1 year) and Olly Stone (1 year). Jacob Bethell and Josh Hull have signed development contracts, as has John Turner who did so last year as well.

Full list of England's centrally contracted players for the 2024/25 season

Name County Contract Length
Gus Atkinson Surrey 2 years
Harry Brook Yorkshire 2 years
Jos Buttler Lancashire 2 years
Joe Root Yorkshire 2 years
Jamie Smith Surrey 2 years
Ben Stokes Durham 2 years
Mark Wood Durham 2 years
Rehan Ahmed Leicestershire 1 year
Jofra Archer Sussex 1 year
Jonny Bairstow Yorkshire 1 year
Shoaib Bashir Somerset 1 year
Brydon Carse Durham 1 year
Zak Crawley Kent 1 year
Sam Curran Surrey 1 year
Ben Duckett Nottinghamshire 1 year
Will Jacks Surrey 1 year
Jack Leach Somerset 1 year
Liam Livingstone Lancashire 1 year
Ollie Pope Surrey 1 year
Matthew Potts Durham 1 year
Adil Rashid Yorkshire 1 year
Phil Salt Lancashire 1 year
Olly Stone Nottinghamshire 1 year
Josh Tongue Nottinghamshire 1 year
Reece Topley Surrey 1 year
Chris Woakes Warwickshire 1 year
Jacob Bethell Warwickshire Development contract
Josh Hull Leicestershire Development contract
John Turner Hampshire Development contract
